DSC can be used to determine midpoints of thermal transitions (Tm) as well as the associated calorimetric and v'ant Hoff enthalpies. These measurements can be made for any process induced by a change in temperature.

ANS binds to hydrophobic surfaces. In a folded, native protein ANS binding is low, however in many designed proteins examined ANS binding is higher than normal.This would suggest exposure of more of the hydrophobic core than in a native, compact protein.
1H NMR measures the nuclear spin reorientation of hydrogen nuclei in a magnetic field using radiowaves. Signals from 1H nuclei in alpha carbons, methyl, amide, and aromatic groups can be detected.

assay: Combination of : RP-HPLC, 1H-NMR and specific binding to Lys-Sepharose
